intro: Flemingia semialata, commonly known as the slender flemingia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and it produces small, elliptical pods that contain several seeds. Flemingia semialata is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
